member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.GECache
member.summary: This method provides access to the GE Object Cache which is used to cache GE objects (primarily for sub-types) in the ASP.NET Session object in XML form. This method is only avaialble after the WebDataControl has been added to a page, prior to that, the method will throw an exception

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieves all of the data from the bound controls, passes it to the GE, and then calls the GE save.
False is save did not occur. True if save did occur.
[joshuag] 3/8/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.RegisterSaveErrorMessage(System.String@)
member.summary: This method is responsible for registering the script to display the error message for saving a record, if one exists. If one does not exist, a generic message will be shown.
member.History: 2007/07/10 GCM Updated to use the sError passed to it

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.RegisterRecordDNEMessageAndCloseWindow(System.String)
member.summary: This method will display an alert message to the user and close the window (this window) automatically afterwards.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.RegisterConfirmationUserMessageForRevert(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the confirmation message to user. If user agree to revert, Record will be reverted back to last saved.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.ConfigNewSubType(System.String,Aptify.Framework.DataServices.UserCredentials,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Used for opening a New SubType Record. This allows for the correct linking to parent Entity.
member.remarks: NOTE: In order for a new SubType Record to be properly handled, this method MUST be used.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.GetCorrespondingObject(Aptify.Framework.BusinessLogic.GenericEntity.AptifyGenericEntityBase,Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry)
member.summary: This method returns a corresponding object in the TopLevelGE's sub-type (any level of sub-type) by going from the provided cache entry's GE object and building a direct path to the object using the parent links. Once the path is built, the corresponding object in the TopLevelGE is found and returned. If nothing is found that matches, then the value of Nothing/Null is returned.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.SendDialogCloseCommand
member.summary: This method is called from the DoSubTypeSave() method in order to send javascript to the client to tell it to close its window. In addition this method will send the GE XML stream for the current object back to the client so that it can be passed back to the calling window.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.GetImageURL(System.Web.UI.Page,Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.ToolbarImages)
member.summary: Returns a web URL for the

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.SetupClientHandlers
member.summary: This method is responsible for setting up the Callback functionality. Currently, this is being used for deleting records.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.GetCallbackResult
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. Result of the Callback gets sent back to the Client-side function by this method. The JavaScript function can be modified to do whatever is necessary with the results.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.RaiseCallbackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. This method is the server-side of the asynchronous callback event. Here is where all the functionality is defined for what to do on a Callback.
member.param: eventArgument is a string defined on the JavaScript side. This string must be delimited by the '|' (pipe) character. The first parameter in this string should be the identifier used to determine what action to take. For example, 'DELETE' is passed in as the first parameter in this string for entity record deletion.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.TranslateStringToJava(System.String)
member.summary: Transform a regular string to one that will run in a javascript.
member.param: Normal String which may containg single or double quotes.
member.returns: Returns a string that has been translated to a java-friendly string

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataControl.GetChangesSinceLastSaveMessage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the Changes made since last save to the record and return the appropriate message string. If BlnRevertToSavedRecord is set true, function will message for the RevertToSaved functionality.

member.summary: This method is responsible for setting up the client-side event handlers.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachments.OnUploadClick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method is responsible for handling the server-side upload process. The method can be overloaded in sub-classes if desired to alter the standard processing logic. The base class saves the file in a temporary location determined by the System environment TEMP variable and then moves the file into the Aptify Attachments database location, subsequently then deleting the temporary file.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachments.KillFile(System.String)
member.summary: This method wraps the System.IO.File.Delete() method with exception handling in the event that the method fails. The method returns True if the file was deleted succesfully, and False if either the file didn't exist, or another exception occured during processing.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachments
member.summary: Aptify Attachments Control for ASP.NET - Provides a User Interface on the web for attachment viewing/uploading

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebDataFieldFormComponentBase.SetupLabelText(System.String)
member.summary: This method internally sets the label caption. If a value of Nothing/Null or a blank string is provided to this method, the internal meta-data for the field is used instead. In addition, this method will automatically map a field's culture in order to change the display name based on the culture of the field if necessary, but that is only done if the LabelCaption parameter exactly matches the DisplayName of the field. Override this method to change the base functionality.

member.summary: This method is responsible for building the grid data source and binding to it based on the information inside the sub-type that this sub-type control is bound to

member.summary: All controls are created and defined in this Subroutine.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl.GetImageURL(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a web URL for the image specified. This image file must be defined as a WebResource for the Aptify.Framework.Web.Common Namespace.
member.returns: URL reference to a the server-side resource file.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl.InitializeGridProperties
member.summary: This method is called when the grid's properties need to be initialized

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl.SetupClientHandlers
member.summary: This method is responsible for setting up the Callback functionality. Currently, this is being used for deleting SubType records. The Result and Error JavaScript functions are defined in WebSubType.js, while the Callback and Delete button's click event are setup below.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl.GetCallbackResult
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. Result of the Callback gets sent back to the Client-side function by this method. The JavaScript function can be modified to do whatever is necessary with the results.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl.RaiseCallbackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. This method is the server-side of the asynchronous callback event. Here is where all the functionality is defined for what to do on a Callback.
member.param: eventArgument is a string defined on the JavaScript side. This string must be delimited by the '|' (pipe) character. The first parameter in this string should be the identifier used to determine what action to take. For example, 'DELETE' is passed in as the first parameter in this string for SubType record deletion.
member.remarks: Currently, the Callback is only setup to handle SubType record deletion. This method maintains a session variable of all the records that are to be deleted when the TopLevel entity is saved. WebDataControl has been modified to check this session variable on Save. The RaiseCallbackEvent can be further extended to handle other callbacks.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebSubTypeControl
member.summary: Aptify Sub-Type ASP.NET Server Control. The current version of this control only supports reading sub-type data

member.summary: Aptify HTML Editor Server Control for ASP.NET

member.summary: Provides an "Active Button" Style web button for use in toolbars, and anywhere else where the style is required

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinkBoxHandler.UserCredentials
member.summary: If calling the ProcessRequest method from the IHttpHandler interface, this UserCredentials property must be set BEFORE the ProcessRequest method is called

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinkBoxHandler.ProcessRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: This method supports the following assumed Request parameters: EntityID, EntityName and ParentID. Either EntityID or EntityName should be specified, EntityID takes precedence if both are specified. Lastly, ParentID specifies the Parent Topic Code ID to use for filtering, if not specified, assumed to be top level topic codes only

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinkBoxHandler.WriteParentParentInfo(System.Web.HttpContext,Aptify.Framework.DataServices.DataAction,System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes the Parent Topic Code information attributes (ParentParentID, ParentParentName) for a given topic code

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinkBoxHandler
member.summary: This class provides base functionality for returning XML to the client for the record lookup functionality of the Link Box control. Uses the EntityID and a Lookup value. This functionality is used by the client-side JavaScript XML in the Web Link Box control to dynamically retrieve the Record ID or to indicate that the Find dialog needs to be displayed.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.FillWidth
member.summary: Determines if the control will fill the parent container's width at run time on the client-side (done via client-side Java Script). Maps to the fillWidth run-time HTML element attribute.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.FillHeightMargin
member.summary: This property is only used if FillHeight is set to True. If FillHeight is set to True, this property determines the margin to use on the bottom side of the control when filling the container's height. This property specifies the number of pixels of space to be left on the bottom side of the control between the control's edge and the container's edge.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.FillWidthMargin
member.summary: This property is only used if FillWidth is set to True. If FillWidth is set to True, this property determines the margin to use on the right side of the control when filling the container's width. This property specifies the number of pixels of space to be left on the right side of the control between the control's edge and the container's edge.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.FillHeight
member.summary: Determines if the control will fill the parent container's height at run time on the client-side (done via client-side Java Script). Maps to the fillHeight run-time HTML element attribute.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.FillIgnoreChildren
member.summary: Determines if the control's children will be evaluated for resizing or not. The default value for this property is True, which results in the children of the control NOT being evaluated for resizing. Sub-classes can override this as required, as can individual instances of the class being used at run-time or design-time. It is important to leave this property set to True as much as possible as it reduces run-time resizing overhead.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.ErrorLabel
member.summary: This label is an internal feature of the base class that can be used by sub-classes to display error messages to the user when required. Set the ErrorLabel.Visible = True first, and then set the ErrorLabel.Text to the appropriate message for the user.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Adds a reference to the object for the data control. In the case of it being added, the reference to the bound control base object is added to the data controls collection.
[joshuag] 3/9/2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.Application
member.summary: Returns an instance of the AptifyApplication object

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebFormComponentBase.DataAction
member.summary: Returns an instance of the Aptify DataAction object

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.SubTypeName
member.summary: Name of sub-type that is currently being displayed in the sub-type control

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.CreateChildControls
member.summary: All controls are created and defined in this Subroutine.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.BuildGrid
member.summary: This method is responsible for building the grid data source and binding to it based on the information inside the sub-type that this sub-type control is bound to

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetImageURL(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a web URL for the image specified. This image file must be defined as a WebResource for the Aptify.Framework.Web.Common Namespace.
member.returns: URL reference to a the server-side resource file.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.InitializeGridProperties
member.summary: This method is called when the grid's properties need to be initialized

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.BuindGridColumns
member.summary: Format the each and every columns of the Grid. Specified and set the column datatype, its visibility, datafield, etc.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.SetupClientHandlers
member.summary: This method is responsible for setting up the Callback functionality. Currently, this is being used for deleting Weblinks records. The Result and Error JavaScript functions are defined in WebLinksControl.js, while the Callback and Delete button's click event are setup below.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetCallbackResult
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. Result of the Callback gets sent back to the Client-side function by this method. The JavaScript function can be modified to do whatever is necessary with the results.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.RaiseCallbackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: This method is required by ICallbackEventHandler. This method is the server-side of the asynchronous callback event. Here is where all the functionality is defined for what to do on a Callback.
member.param: eventArgument is a string defined on the JavaScript side. This string must be delimited by the '|' (pipe) character. The first parameter in this string should be the identifier used to determine what action to take. For example, 'DELETE' is passed in as the first parameter in this string for SubType record deletion.
member.remarks: Currently, the Callback is only setup to handle SubType record deletion and addition also. This method maintains a session variable of all the records that are to be deleted/added when the TopLevel entity is saved. WebDataControl has been modified to check this session variable on Save. The RaiseCallbackEvent can be further extended to handle other callbacks.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetRecordName(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Get the Record Name to be displayed in the Grid object. If Record is related to Persons or Companies or Employees entity, Record name is being formatted to show the Email address and Phone number.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetRecordNamePersons(System.Int64,System.String@)
member.summary: Updates RecordName parameter with the Record Name that will be displayed in the Links control for Persons records. Current format is: Entity Record Name [New Line] Phone: [Person's Phone Number] [New Line] E-mail: [Person's E-mail]

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.FormatPhoneNumber(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Given the components of a Phone Number produce and return a formatted phone number as a single string. If no phone number is provided, return "Phone: Not Provided"

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.FormatEmail(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Format the e-mail address and return it as a string. If no e-mail address is provided, return Label + " " + "Not Provided" Otherwise, return Label + " " + Email

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetRecordNameCompanies(System.Int64,System.String@)
member.summary: Updates RecordName parameter with the Record Name that will be displayed in the Links control for Companies records. Current format is: Entity Record Name [New Line] Account Manager: [Company's Main Account Manager] [New Line] Phone: [Company's Main Phone Number] [New Line] E-mail: [Company's Main E-mail]

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl.GetRecordNameEmployees(System.Int64,System.String@)
member.summary: Updates RecordName parameter with the Record Name that will be displayed in the Links control for Employees records. Current format is: Entity Record Name [New Line] Phone: [Employee's Phone Number] [New Line] E-mail: [Employee's Main E-mail]

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLinksControl
member.summary: Aptify Web Links ASP.NET Server Control. Issue 5464, Maulik Patel, 09/28/2007

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.RootVariable
member.summary: This method tracks the variable name for the "root" entry into the Session object's dictionary, all entries by this object will have this variable as their root entry into the session.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.GetChildGEObjects(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method will create a list of Aptify GE objects that are directly or indirectly child objects of the provided RootEntity/RootRecordID record.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.GetRootEntityRecordID(Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry)
member.summary: Returns the root entity record ID for the provided entity name and record ID combination

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.GetRootEntityRecordID(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the root entity record ID for the provided entity name and record ID combination

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.GetParentEntityRecordID(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the parent entity record Id the provided sub-type record is part of

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.GetEntityRecordField(System.String,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of a single field in a single entity record

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.ClearChildGEObjects(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method clears objects from the cache that are child Sub-types (directly or multiple levels down) for the provided Root Entity RecordID as provided by the parameters.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.SaveToSession(System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState)
member.summary: This method will save the entire cache to the provided ASP.NET Session object

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.LoadFromSession(System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState)
member.summary: This method will load the cache from the provided ASP.NET Session object

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Cache
member.summary: Override this member in sub-classes to alter the internal cache structure

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.AddEntry(System.String,System.Int64,Aptify.Framework.BusinessLogic.GenericEntity.AptifyGenericEntityBase)
member.summary: This method returns an Entry object based on the provided parameters. If the specified Entry object already existed (based on the Entity name and RecordID) then it will be replaced by the newly provided GE object

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.AddNewSubTypeEntry(Aptify.Framework.BusinessLogic.GenericEntity.AptifyGenericEntityBase,System.Int64)
member.summary: This function should only be used to add a brand new SubType record. This function will not update or overwrite existing Cache entries, but will instead decrement the RecordID until a unique key is found in the Cache. For example, if a new entry already exists in the Cache with a RecordID of -1, this new entry will be assigned a RecordID of -2.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.FindEntry(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method will return an Entry object from the cache, if one exists, otherwise it will return Null/Nothing

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.FindEntry(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method will return an Entry object from the cache with matching ParentRecordID, if one exists, otherwise it will return Null/Nothing

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.AddEntry(Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry)
member.summary: Adds the specified entry to the cache, if the entry's key value already existed in the internal cache, then the entry is updated to hold the provided Entry object, otherwise the Entry object is added to the cache.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.AddEntry(Aptify.Framework.BusinessLogic.GenericEntity.AptifyGenericEntityBase)
member.summary: Adds the specified GE to the cache, if the entry's key value already existed in the internal cache, then the entry is updated to hold the provided GE object, otherwise the GE object is added to the cache.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.DisableParentUpdates
member.summary: This is an internal variable used to determine if parent link updates should be disabled. This is typically done during the LoadFromSession operation

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.UpdateParent(Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry)
member.summary: This method is responsible for finding and updating the parent GE in the cache, if it is in the cache, and updating the GE sub-type object.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.GEObject
member.summary: Reference to the internal GE instance

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.AptifyApplication
member.summary: returns a reference to the AptifyApplication within this class

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.DataAction
member.summary: Returns a reference to an instance of the Aptify DataAction class

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.SaveToSession(System.String,System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState)
member.summary: This method is responsible for saving session state from the object into the ASP.NET Session object. Must provied SessionKey parameter to provide the object with the needed information to store its value in the session

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.#ctor(Aptify.Framework.Application.AptifyApplication,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: This is required for new SubType records to link to their Parent correctly

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.#ctor(Aptify.Framework.Application.AptifyApplication,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This is required for new SubType records to link to their Parent correctly and maintain a Custom Key, since the key is usually based on RecordID, but multiple new records will each have a RecordID of -1. Used specifically for GEObjectCache.LoadFromSession()
member.param: Custom Key - used to maintain uniqueness for multiple new SubType records, since they all have a RecordID of -1.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.Entity
member.summary: Returns the entity name for the current GE object, only works after the GEObject property is set.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.RootEntityRecordID
member.summary: Record ID in the root entity that this sub-type is related to, only is functional for sub-types

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.GetRootEntityRecordID(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the root entity record ID for the provided entity name and record ID combination

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.GetParentEntityRecordID(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the parent entity record Id the provided sub-type record is part of

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.GetEntityRecordField(System.String,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of a single field in a single entity record

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.KeyID
member.summary: This property will override the Key Property by explicitly defining the Entry's Key. This property was created to support multiple New SubType Records within the Cache.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.RecordID
member.summary: Returns the RecordID for the current GE object, only works after the GEObject property is set.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.Saved
member.summary: The Saved Property maintains the state of the entry. If an entry represents a record that has not yet been saved, Saved is False. Once the record for this entry has been saved, this value is set to True. This is used to determine if an entry should be kept or tossed.

member.name: P:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.Key
member.summary: Returns the cache key for the current record. If a custom KeyID has been defined for this Entry, this will be returned.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry.GetKey(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Static/Shared method to generate a key based on a provided Entity Name and Record ID pair.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache.Entry
member.summary: This class is used for managing a single cached GE instance and is capable of storing the XML data in its internal cache.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.GEObjectCache
member.summary: This class is responsible for doing server-side XML caching for GE objects. The cache is capable of storing and retrieving any number of cache entries based upon the provided methods. The GEObjectCache stores GEObjectCache.Entry objects within its internal data structure.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebNoControl
member.summary: This class is used to display a label whenever a registered Form Component is not found for a Form Template Part

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachmentsIframe.GetAttachmentHTML
member.summary: Returns the IFRAME object that loads the Attachment.aspx page into. Attachment.aspx page loads the original WebAttachment object inside it.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachmentsIframe.GetAttachmentURL
member.summary: This method is responsible for getting the attachment URL for the attachment tab.

member.name: M:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachmentsIframe.FormComponentConfig(Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.AptifyFormTemplateContext)
member.summary: Overrides the Sub FormComponentConfig and also save the FormTemplateContext into the session. This session variable is used to pass the FormTemplateContext into the original WebAttachment object when this object is loaded into the attachment.aspx page.

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebAttachmentsIframe
member.summary: Aptify Attachments Control for ASP.NET - Provides a User Interface on the web for attachment viewing/uploading To solve issue 5419, Maulik Patel, 09/14/2007

member.name: T:Aptify.Framework.Web.Common.WebLineSeparator
member.summary: Draws a horizontal or vertical line. Optional Input Property "SeparatorSize" can be used to specify size of separator. If not specified, value of 1 is used.
